belonging to the department without permission. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-2-3: RESIGNATION:
Under normal circumstances, a notice of resignation of not less than two (2)
weeks shall be given to the fire chief by an officer or firefighter unless
otherwise provided in the collective bargaining agreement. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-
2000)
5-2-4: CORDON AROUND EMERGENCY SCENE:
The chief of the fire department, an assistant chief or any member in command,
may prescribe limits in the vicinity of any fire, or other emergency incident
within which no person excepting firefighters and policemen and those admitted
by order of any officer of the fire department, shall be permitted to come.
(Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-2-5: POWER OF ARREST:
As provided for the statutes of the state as the same have been implemented by
the city, certain designated officers may be authorized to have the power of
arrest providing they meet the requirements established by law. (Ord. 1653, 4-
18-2000)
5-2-6: IMPERSONATING FIREFIGHTERS:
No person not a member of the fire department shall impersonate a firefighter
or officer of the fire department under a penalty of not less than seventy five
dollars ($75.00) nor more than two hundred dollars ($200.00) for each offense.
(Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-2-7: PROPERTY SAVED:
No person shall be entitled to take away any property in the possession of the
fire department saved from any fire until he shall make satisfactory proof of
ownership thereof. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-2-8: FALSE ALARM:
Any person who shall intentionally in the city give or make a false alarm of
fire, shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction thereof, be
fined not less than seventy five dollars ($75.00) nor more than five hundred
dollars ($500.00). (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-2-9: OBSTRUCTING DEPARTMENT; DRIVING OVER HOSE:
Any person who shall wilfully resist, obstruct or hinder or interfere with any
member of the fire department in the performance of his or her duty connected
with the fire department, or shall wilfully or negligently in any manner
injure, break or deface any engine, hose, truck, or other fire apparatus or
equipment belonging to the city, or shall wilfully or negligently drive any
vehicle across or upon any hose, shall, upon conviction thereof, be fined not
less than seventy five dollars ($75.00) nor more than five hundred dollars
($500.00) for each offense. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-2-10: FOLLOWING FIRETRUCK:
No person driving a motor vehicle of any kind, shall follow within two hundred
fifty feet (250') any fire engine, firetruck, or other fire apparatus while
said engine, truck, or apparatus is proceeding to a fire, and any person
violating the provisions of this section shall, upon conviction, be fined not
less than seventy five dollars ($75.00) nor more than five hundred dollars
($500.00) for each offense. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-2-11: OBSTRUCTING HYDRANT:
No person shall in any manner obstruct the use of any fire hydrant, or place
any material, including shrubs or bushes, in front thereof or within five feet
(5') of either side thereof, under a penalty of seventy five dollars ($75.00)
for each offense, and any and all material forming such an obstruction may be
summarily removed by any member of the fire department or other city services
such as the street department or water department without notice to the owner
or occupant of the property and at the risk, cost and expense of the owner or
claimant thereof. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-2-12: INTERNATIONAL FIRE CODE APPLICATION:
The city reemphasizes those provisions of the 2003 international fire code, the
appendix chapters thereof and the 2004 supplement pertaining to installation of
combustion devices and other instrumentalities capable of initiating combustion
by contact. The city has previously adopted the 2003 international fire code,
along with the appendix chapters thereof and the 2004 supplement, and said
supplements shall have the same force and effect of the 2003 international fire
code, and shall be included in any reference made to "the code". The Canton
fire department shall have the authority to enforce the 2003 international fire
code, its appendix chapters and the 2004 supplement. The fire chief, or his
designees, shall have the authority to issue a citation to the owner, operator,
occupant or other person responsible for the condition which constitutes a
violation of said code. Further, storage of combustible or flammable material
shall be in accordance with the said code. Any person violating any 2003
international fire code provisions of this nature shall be fined not less than
seventy five dollars ($75.00) nor more than five hundred dollars ($500.00).
(Ord. 1864, 5-2-2006)
5-2-13: PENALTY:
Any person violating any of the provisions of this chapter, or failing to
comply with the same, where no other penalty is provided, shall be subject to a
fine of not less than seventy five dollars ($75.00) nor more than five hundred
dollars ($500.00) for each offense. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
CHAPTER 3
PAID ON CALL FIREFIGHTERS
SECTION:
5-3-1: Title
5-3-2: Organization Created
5-3-3: Requirements Of Firefighters
5-3-4: Course Of Training
5-3-5: Personal Data Required; Identification Card
5-3-6: Equipment
5-3-7: Discipline Of Firefighters
5-3-8: Duties
5-3-9: Monthly Training Required
5-3-10: Pay For Services Rendered
5-3-11: Insurance Coverage
5-3-1: TITLE:
This chapter may be referred to as the PAID ON CALL FIREFIGHTER ORDINANCE.
(Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-3-2: ORGANIZATION CREATED:
A paid on call firefighter organization for the city is hereby created and
established. The organization shall consist of not more than six (6) "paid on
call" firefighters each of whom shall have been appointed by the mayor upon the
recommendation of the fire chief with the advice and consent of the city
council. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-3-3: REQUIREMENTS OF FIREFIGHTERS:
Paid on call firefighters shall meet the following minimum requirements: each
of them shall be a citizen, eighteen (18) years or older, meeting the residency
requirements established for regular members of the fire department of this
city, shall not be members of the regular fire department, shall be of good
moral character, and shall not have ever been convicted of a felony or any
crime involving moral turpitude. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-3-4: COURSE OF TRAINING:
Prior to entering upon any of their duties, each paid on call firefighter shall
receive a course of training in the use of equipment and such firefighting
procedures as shall be appropriate for the performance of their duties as
contemplated by this chapter and as shall be determined and provided by the
corporate authorities of this city from time to time. Such training shall be to
not less than the firefighter II level if that person is to be engaged in
interior structural firefighting. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-3-5: PERSONAL DATA REQUIRED; IDENTIFICATION CARD:
A candidate for appointment to the paid on call firefighters force of this
city, as a condition to appointment, shall be fingerprinted and shall provide
such other personal data as may be requested by the fire chief of this city,
such prints and data to be maintained by said fire chief. Each paid on call
firefighter, at the expense of the city will be provided with a suitable
identification card which, among other personal data, shall contain and display
a suitable picture of the applicable paid on call firefighter. (Ord. 1653, 4-
18-2000)
5-3-6: EQUIPMENT:
Paid on call firefighters shall be provided with appropriate firefighting gear
and equipment as determined by and at the expense of this city. Such gear or
equipment as is worn may be similar or identical to that worn by the members of
the regular fire department of this city excepting, however, helmets worn by
paid on call firefighters shall be sharply and conspicuously distinctive from
those worn by members of the regular fire department of this city. Such gear
and equipment shall remain the property of the city and shall be returned to
the fire chief of this city upon termination of the services of any paid on
call firefighter. Such gear and equipment shall be maintained in the condition
and at the place or places, as may from time to time be determined by the fire
chief of this city. Appropriate records delineating the disposition of all gear
and equipment shall be kept current by the fire chief of this city. (Ord. 1653,
4-18-2000)
5-3-7: DISCIPLINE OF FIREFIGHTERS:
Paid on call firefighters shall at all times during the performance of their
duties be subject to the following discipline: they shall be subject to the
direction and control of the fire chief of this city. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-3-8: DUTIES:
Paid on call firefighters shall be assigned to perform the following duties of
this city and none other: paid on call firefighters shall assist the regular
fire department of this city in the performance of their duties when called
upon. Paid on call firefighters may be called to perform such duties by any one
of the following:
   (A)   The fire chief of this city;
   (B)   Any assistant fire chief of this city;
   (C)   Any lieutenant of the fire department. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-3-9: MONTHLY TRAINING REQUIRED:
Paid on call firefighters shall receive training not less than three (3) hours
in each calendar month or in accordance with the department of labor standards
whichever is greater. The course of training in terms of context and direction
shall be as from time to time prescribed by the fire chief of this city. Any
paid on call firefighter who misses more than two (2) training sessions in any
six (6) month period shall, upon recommendation of the fire chief, made in
writing to the mayor of this city, be removed from his or her position as a
paid on call firefighter. The fire chief shall have the authority to establish
requirements and rules for paid on call firefighters. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-3-10: PAY FOR SERVICES RENDERED:
Each paid on call firefighter shall receive pay for services rendered to this
city as determined from time to time by the city council.
The fire chief shall be personally responsible for certifying pay entitlements
of paid on call firefighters on a weekly basis to the appropriate officials of
this city, the same to be in his or her monthly report. Payment for services
rendered shall be made to each paid on call firefighter on the regularly
scheduled pay period. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-3-11: INSURANCE COVERAGE:
No paid on call firefighter shall be appointed or enter upon his or her duties
as such unless and until insurance coverage (as contemplated by the cities and
villages act of the state of Illinois and as set forth under division 5 of the
municipal code of 1961) has been procured and declared fully operative and
effective in writing by an insurance carrier pursuant to a policy carried by
and with this city. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
CHAPTER 4
FOREIGN FIRE INSURANCE COMPANIES
SECTION:
5-4-1: Tax Imposed
5-4-2: Report Receipts
5-4-3: Payment
5-4-4: Failure To Report
5-4-5: Fire Department Foreign Fire Insurance Board; Election; Officers; Duties
5-4-6: Treasurer's Bond; Use Of Funds
5-4-7: Audit Of Funds
5-4-8: Disbursement Of Funds
5-4-9: Penalty
5-4-1: TAX IMPOSED:
All corporations, companies and associations not incorporated under the laws of
the state of Illinois, and which are engaged in the city in effecting or
soliciting fire insurance, shall pay to the city treasurer, on or before July
15 of each and every year, a sum equal to two percent (2%) of the gross
receipts of premiums received by such corporation, company or association, or
their agency or agents, for business effected or transacted for fire insurance
within the city, for the year ending July 1 next preceding. The sum above named
shall be a tax or license fee upon all such corporations, companies or
associations transacting said business within the city. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-4-2: REPORT RECEIPTS:
Every person, acting as agent or otherwise, for or upon behalf of any such
corporation, company or association, shall on or before July 15 of each and
every year render to the clerk of the city a full, true and just account,
verified by oath, of all the premiums which during the year ending on July 1
next preceding, shall have been received by him, or any other person for him,
in behalf of any such corporation, company or association, and shall fully and
specifically set out in said report, the amount or amounts received as premiums
for fire insurance. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-4-3: PAYMENT:
The said agent or agents shall also, at the time of the making of the above
mentioned report, pay to the city treasurer the said sum of two percent (2%)
upon the gross receipts of such corporation, company or association, obtained
as premiums for effecting fire insurance in the city, as is specified in
section
5-4-1 of this chapter. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-4-4: FAILURE TO REPORT:
If such account be not rendered on or before the day herein designated for that
purpose, or if the above mentioned rates for the said tax or license fee shall
remain unpaid after that day, it shall be unlawful for any such corporation,
company or association to transact any business of fire insurance in the city,
until the requirements hereof have been fully complied with; nevertheless, this
provision shall in no way affect the validity of any risk that may be taken in
violation hereof, between such corporation, company or association, and the
person so insured. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-4-5: FIRE DEPARTMENT FOREIGN FIRE INSURANCE BOARD; ELECTION; OFFICERS;
DUTIES:
The members of the Canton fire department shall elect officers of the
department foreign fire insurance board. These officers shall be a chairperson,
secretary and a treasurer. The board shall consist of these three (3) persons.
It shall develop and maintain a listing of items which it feels are appropriate
expenditures of the fund. The corporate authorities of the city shall annually
appropriate all of the money paid to the municipal treasurer per section
5-4-1 of this chapter to the department foreign fire insurance board. (Ord.
1653, 4-18-2000)
5-4-6: TREASURER'S BOND; USE OF FUNDS:
The treasurer of the department foreign fire insurance board shall give a
sufficient bond to the municipality which shall be approved by the mayor,
conditioned upon the faithful performance by the treasurer of his or her duties
under the ordinance and as provided by law. He or she shall pay out the money
upon the order of the department foreign fire insurance board for the
maintenance, use and benefit of the department. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-4-7: AUDIT OF FUNDS:
As part of the annual municipal audit, the funds described in this chapter
shall be audited to verify that the purchases made with the funds are for the
maintenance, use and benefit of the department. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-4-8: DISBURSEMENT OF FUNDS:
The amount so collected shall be paid by the city treasurer to the treasurer of
the foreign fire insurance board who shall receive and pay out the same upon
the order of said board for the purposes of maintenance, use and benefit of
such department, as provided in section
5-1-4 of this title. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
5-4-9: PENALTY:
Any person, corporation, company or association which violates any of the
provisions of this chapter is guilty of a class B misdemeanor as provided by
the Illinois Compiled Statutes. (Ord. 1653, 4-18-2000)
CHAPTER 5
FIREMEN'S PENSION FUND
SECTION:
5-5-1: Board Of Trustees, Established
5-5-2: Pension Fund Created
5-5-3: Treasurer Of Fund
5-5-4: Management Of Fund
5-5-5: Rewards, Gifts; Permanent Fund
5-5-6: Sell Assets, Draw Fund
5-5-7: Interest From Investment Of Fund
5-5-8: Retirement; Physical Or Mental Disability
5-5-9: Recall To Active Duty
5-5-10: Death While In Service
5-5-11: Retirement; Twenty Years' Service
5-5-12: Custodian Of Fund
5-5-13: Mayor To Draw Warrants
5-5-14: Warrants Signed
5-5-15: Report Condition Of Fund
5-5-16: Fund Not Subject To Levy
5-5-1: BOARD OF TRUSTEES, ESTABLISHED:
There is hereby established a Board of Trustees of the Firemen's Pension Fund.
Said board shall consist of five (5) members. Two (2) members of the board
shall be appointed by the Mayor of the Municipality. Two (2) members of the
board shall be active participants of the Pension Fund who are elected from the
active participants of the fund. One member of the board shall be a person who
is retired under the Firemen's Pension Fund Act of 1919 who was elected from
persons retired under the Firemen's Pension Fund Act of 1919. The member to be
chosen from the active and retired firefighters shall be elected by ballot at
elections to be held on the third Monday in April of the applicable years under
the Australian ballot system, at such place or places, in the Municipality, and
under such regulations that shall be prescribed by the board. No person shall
cast more than one vote for each candidate for whom he or she is eligible to
vote. In the elections for board members to be chosen from the active
firefighters, all active firefighters and no others may vote. In the elections
for board members to be chosen from retired firefighters, the retired
firefighters and no others may vote. In the event of a failure, resignation or
inability to act of any board member, a successor shall be elected for the
unexpired term at a special election called by the board and shall be conducted
in the same manner as a regular election. The board shall select annually from
its members a President and a Secretary. Board members shall not receive or
have any right to receive any salary from a Pension Fund for services performed
as board members.
Each member of the board so elected shall hold his position as such for a term
of three (3) years and until his or her successor shall have been duly elected
and qualified. (Ord. 4086, 10-17-2017)
5-5-2: PENSION FUND CREATED:
There is hereby created a special fund to be known as the "Firemen's Pension
Fund", which said fund shall be raised and created in the following manner: One
percent (1%) of all revenues collected or received by the City, authorizing
persons or corporations to engage in any business or occupation or profession,
except in that of public utilities, also all fines imposed for violation of
fire regulations, the enforcement or correction of which may be charged to and
be under the supervision of the Chief Officer or subordinate officers of the
Fire Department of the City, also seventy five percent (75%) of all monies
collected as a license or tax upon foreign fire insurance companies doing
business in the City, shall be set apart by the Treasurer of the City to whom
the same shall be paid as a fund for the pensioning of disabled and
superannuated members of the Fire Department, and of the widowers and orphans
and dependent parents of deceased members of the Fire Department of the City.
(1959 Code § 20-7-2)
5-5-3: TREASURER OF FUND:
The City Treasurer of the City shall be Ex Officio Treasurer of said Firemen's
Pension Fund. (1959 Code § 20-7-3)
5-5-4: MANAGEMENT OF FUND:
The said board shall have exclusive control and management of the fund
mentioned in section
5-5-1 of this chapter, and of all monies donated, paid or assessed for the
relief or pensioning of disabled, superannuated and retired members of the Fire
Department, their widows, minor children and dependent parents, and shall
assess each member of the Fire Department eligible to participate in said
Pension Fund not to exceed five percent (5%) of the salary of such member, to
be deducted and withheld from the monthly pay of each member so assessed, the
same to be placed by the treasurer of the city, who shall be ex officio
treasurer of such board. The said board shall make all needful rules and
regulations for its government in the discharge of its duties and shall hear
and decide all applications for relief or pensions under this chapter, and its
decisions on such applications shall be final and conclusive, and not subject
to review or reversal except by the board. The board shall cause to be kept a
record of all its meetings and proceedings. (R.O. 1959, Ch. 20, Art. 7, Sec. 4)
5-5-5: REWARDS, GIFTS; PERMANENT FUND:
All rewards in monies, fees, gifts and emoluments that may be paid or given for
on account of extraordinary services by said fire department or any member
thereof (except when allowed to be retained by competitive award), shall be
paid into said pension fund. The said board of trustees may take by gift,
grant, devise or bequest, any money, real estate, personal property, right of
property or any valuable thing; and such money, real estate, personal property,
right of property or other valuable thing so obtained, also all fines and
penalties imposed upon members of such fire department, shall in like manner be
paid into said pension fund and treated as a part thereof, for the use of such
pension fund; provided, that when the sum of fifteen thousand dollars
($15,000.00) shall be received and accumulated, it shall be, together with all
other sums in excess of fifteen thousand dollars ($15,000.00) when so received
and accumulated, retained as a permanent fund, and any excess thereof, in each
such case, shall be available for the uses and purposes of such pension fund.
(R.O. 1959, Ch. 20, Art. 7, Sec. 5)
5-5-6: SELL ASSETS, DRAW FUND:
   (A)   Power Of Board To Sell Assets: The board of trustees created herein
shall have power to take and may sell or dispose of, in any manner that the
said board in its judgment deems proper, any or all assets of any kind which
are in its possession or under the control of the board of trustees of the
firemen's pension fund, existing at the time of the passage of this chapter,
and all monies and funds realized from the sale of such assets, together with
all other money or funds received or taken over shall become a part of the fund
herein created for the purpose of payment of pensions, under the provisions of
this chapter. (R.O. 1959, Ch. 20, Art. 7, Sec. 6)
   (B)   Power Of Board To Draw Fund, Investing Same, Deposit Of Securities:
The said board of trustees shall have power to draw such pension fund from the
treasurer of the city, and may invest such fund, or any part thereof, in the
name of the "board of trustees of the firemen's pension fund", in interest
bearing bonds of the United States, of the state of Illinois, of any county of
this state, or of any township or of any municipal corporation of the state of
Illinois as well as in tax anticipation warrants of the city. And all such
securities shall be deposited with the treasurer of the city, as ex officio
treasurer of said board and shall be subject to the order of said board. (R.O.
1959, Ch. 20, Art. 7, Sec. 7)
5-5-7: INTEREST FROM INVESTMENT OF FUND:
The interest received from any such investment of said fund, after said fund
shall have reached the sum of fifteen thousand dollars ($15,000.00), shall be
applicable to the payment of pensions under this chapter. (R.O. 1959, Ch. 20,
Art. 7, Sec. 8)
5-5-8: RETIREMENT; PHYSICAL OR MENTAL DISABILITY:
If any member of the fire department of the city shall, while in the
performance of his duty, become and be found, upon examination of a medical
officer ordered by said board of trustees to be physically or mentally
permanently disabled, by reason of service in the fire department, so as to
render necessary his retirement from service in said fire department, said
board of trustees shall retire such disabled member from service in said
department; provided, no such retirement on account of disability shall occur
unless such member has contracted said disability while in the service of said
fire department. Upon such retirement the said board of trustees shall order
the payment to such disabled member of the fire department monthly, from said
pension fund, such sums as provided for by statutes of state of Illinois. (R.O.
1959, Ch. 20, Art. 7, Sec. 9)
5-5-9: RECALL TO ACTIVE DUTY:
If, however, after placing a fireman on the pension roll, satisfactory proof is
made to the pension board that such retired fireman has recovered from such
physical or mental disability, the board shall order that his pension cease,
and the fireman shall report back to the chief of fire department of the city,
who shall thereupon order the reinstatement in active service, in the same
grade or rank which such fireman held at the time of his retirement. (R.O.
1959, Ch. 20, Art. 7, Sec. 10)
5-5-10: DEATH WHILE IN SERVICE:
If any member of the fire department shall die while in the fire service as a
result of any illness or accident to him which had its inception while he was
in such service with pay, or if any fireman shall die from any cause during the
retirement on account of disability, or during the retirement after twenty (20)
years' service, and while in good standing, as provided for herein, and shall
leave a widow, minor natural child or children, or dependent natural father or
mother surviving, said board of trustees shall direct the payment from said
pension fund the following sums of money monthly: Such sums as provided for by
statutes of Illinois. (R.O. 1959, Ch. 20, Art. 7, Sec. 11)
5-5-11: RETIREMENT; TWENTY YEARS' SERVICE:
Any fireman after having served twenty (20) years as a fireman, of which the
last five (5) shall be continuous, may retire from active service, and when
such retired fireman shall have reached the age of fifty (50) years the board
shall order and direct that such fireman shall be paid a monthly pension as
provided for by statutes of Illinois. (R.O. 1959, Ch. 20, Art. 7, Sec. 12)
5-5-12: CUSTODIAN OF FUND:
The treasurer of the board shall be custodian of the pension fund and shall
secure and safely keep the same, subject to the control and directions of the
board, and shall keep his books and accounts concerning said fund in such a
manner as may be prescribed by the board, and the said books and accounts shall
always be subject to the inspection of the board or any member thereof. The
treasurer shall, within ten (10) days after his election, execute a bond to the
city, with good and sufficient securities, in such penal sum as the board shall
direct, to be approved by the board, conditioned for the faithful performance
of the duties of his office, and that he will safely keep and well and truly
account for all monies and property which may come into his hands as such
treasurer, and that on the expiration of his term of office, he will surrender
and deliver over to his successor all unexpended monies and all property which
may have come into his hands as treasurer of such fund. Such bond shall be
filed in the office of the city clerk, and in case of breach of the same, or
the conditions thereof, suit may be brought on the same in the name of the
city, for the use of said board, or of any person or persons injured by such
breach. (R.O. 1959, Ch. 20, Art. 7, Sec. 13)
5-5-13: MAYOR TO DRAW WARRANTS:
It shall be the duty of the mayor and the city clerk, upon request made in
writing by said board, to draw warrants upon the treasurer of the city, payable
to the treasurer of the board for all funds in the hands of the treasurer of
the city, belonging to said pension fund. (R.O. 1959, Ch. 20, Art. 7, Sec. 14)
5-5-14: WARRANTS SIGNED:
All monies ordered to be paid from said pension fund to any person or persons,
shall be paid by the treasurer of the board only upon warrants signed by the
president of the board and countersigned by the secretary thereof, and no
warrants shall be drawn except by order of the board duly entered in the
records of the proceedings of the board. In case the said pension fund or any
part thereof, shall, by order of said board or otherwise, be deposited in any
bank, or loaned, all interest or money which may be paid or agreed to be paid
on account of any such loan or deposit, shall belong to and constitute a part
of said fund; provided, that nothing herein contained shall be construed as
authorizing said treasurer to loan or deposit said fund or any part thereof,
unless so authorized by the board. (R.O. 1959, Ch. 20, Art. 7, Sec. 15)
5-5-15: REPORT CONDITION OF FUND:
The board of trustees shall make report to the council of the city, of the
condition of said pension fund on January 1 in each and every year. (R.O. 1959,
Ch. 20, Art. 7, Sec. 16)
5-5-16: FUND NOT SUBJECT TO LEVY:
No portion of said pension fund shall, either before or after its order of
distribution by said board to any retired member of said fire department, or to
the widow or guardian of such minor child or children, or to the dependent
parent or parents, of a deceased or retired member of the fire department, be
held, seized, taken, subject to, or detained or levied on by virtue of any
attachment, execution, injunction, writ, interlocutory or other order or
decree, or any process of proceeding whatever issued out of or by any court of
this state for the payment or satisfaction in whole or in part of any debt,
damages, claim, demand or judgment against any such member or his said widow,
or the guardian of said minor child or children, or dependent parent or
parents, of any deceased member, but said fund shall be sacredly held, kept,
secured and distributed for the purposes of pensioning the persons named in
this chapter. (R.O. 1959, Ch. 20, Art. 7, Sec. 17)
CHAPTER 6
FIRE CODE
SECTION:
5-6-1: Code Adopted
5-6-2: Permit Fees
5-6-3: Amendments
5-6-4: Enforcement
5-6-5: Penalty
5-6-1: CODE ADOPTED:
The 2003 international fire code, the appendix chapters and the 2004 supplement
shall be, and the same are hereby adopted as the fire code of the city of
Canton. (Ord. 1864, 5-2-2006)
5-6-2: PERMIT FEES:
   (A)   The Canton fire department shall issue permits pursuant to the
international fire code, 2003 edition, the appendix chapters and the 2004
supplement, hereafter called "code". The fee shall be paid to the city
treasurer. No permit is valid until the applicable fee, if any, is paid in
full.
   (B)   Other governmental entities, located within the corporate limits of
the city of Canton, shall be exempt from the permit fees, but shall be required
to obtain a permit for any of the applicable categories listed herein.
   (C)   Permits for each individual category shall be required to be paid by
the owner/occupant at a cost of twenty five dollars ($25.00) each, with a
maximum of one hundred dollars ($100.00). The maximum of one hundred dollars
($100.00), annually, shall apply even if more than four (4) permits are
required. The following is a list of the applicable categories for which
permits are required, as outlined in the 2003 international fire code:
